abstract: Fate of Paramount Pictures film Drunk Wedding, predicted to be low-budget, high-profit hit but ending up video on demand outcast, illuminates difficulties of marketing small original movies from inside major studio; faced with project with no big stars, risky amount of adolescent-level crudeness and nothing similar to use as a marketing blueprint, Paramount executives chose not to risk the high coast of a major theatrical release, and went instead for the guaranteed return on investment of video on demand.
lead_paragraph: Paramount Pictures’ microbudget comedy “Drunk Wedding” had a successful screening and the studio’s support, but it was still left at the altar.

headline.main: ‘Drunk Wedding’ Faced Too High a Bar to the Big Screen
headline.print_headline: Too High a Bar to the Big Screen

snippet: Paramount Pictures’ microbudget comedy “Drunk Wedding” had a successful screening and the studio’s support, but it was still left at the altar.
